content.description: Start on a slanted foothold with your left foot, stand up on it, and kick out your right foot to a ledge-y feature. There are some reasonable handholds to start (see the attached image). Use the small sidepull on the wall to shift your weight to the right, and work your feet to the right using the obvious jugs. On the second face, get as far out to the right as possible to kick your right leg into the crack between the second and third face. Get your right hand to a reasonable hold right next to the crack. Match, then do some finicky smearing, and use one crimpy hold to get up to the top out on the upper right. This is really a very fun route using a bunch of different styles.
content.protection: A pad is useful at the start (the first move is finicky). It is pretty low to ground the whole time.
content.location: Park at Campsite 5, and take the climber's trail past the main wall and Beetlejuice up over a ridge until you reach the boulderfield. It is not more than 5-ish minutes at a good pace.

content.description: This is on the thin and smooth-looking overhanging face across from the Aspen Boulder. Start with low crimps.

This starts on a low jug and ascends a blunt arete and seam left of

Stompin'

. It's close to another boulder.
content.location: It is to the left of the face across from the Aspen Boulder.

content.description:
Climb the rounded dihedral on the opposite side of

Stompin'

.
